thread.title: CU chancellor defends hosting GOP presidential debate
thread.title_full: CU chancellor defends hosting GOP presidential debate

title: CU chancellor defends hosting GOP presidential debate
text:
CU chancellor defends hosting GOP presidential debate Phil DiStefano said students will receive a majority of the university's 100 tickets. Post to Facebook CU chancellor defends hosting GOP presidential debate Phil DiStefano said students will receive a majority of the university's 100 tickets.  //on9news.tv/1Rw1taP   Join the Conversation To   CU chancellor defends hosting GOP presidential debate Associated Press, news source 10:02 a.m. MDT October 8, 2015 CU-Boulder Chancellor Philip P. DiStefano (Photo: CU) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BOULDER, Colo. (AP) - University of Colorado's chancellor is defending his decision to host the Republican presidential debate after students demanded the school pull its involvement if organizers refused to increase the number of tickets for students. 
The Daily Camera reports Chancellor Phil DiStefano issued a newsletter saying the Oct. 28 debate is not a public event and is instead a TV broadcast with a studio audience. He said having the debate at the Coors Event Center will increase CU-Boulder's recognition. 
DiStefano said students will receive a majority of the university's 100 tickets. 
Students had passed a resolution demanding the university not host the event if more tickets weren't made available. But the student body presidents vetoed the resolution, saying students could be more engaged by hosting a debate watch party on campus.
